definitions.definition: An enclosed space, within a heat engine, in which the fuel is mixed and reacted with air or other oxidizing agent in a controlled manner
A type of biscuit (cookie), popular in Britain, traditionally made from one part sugar, two parts butter and three parts flour.
Prohibited; not permitted by law (either civil or criminal law; see illegal).
definitions.example: He was charged with unlawful use of a car.

definitions.definition: A tree-dwelling marsupial, Phascolarctos cinereus, that resembles a small bear with a broad head, large ears and sharp claws, mainly found in eastern Australia.
A rank in the RAF, between that of flight lieutenant and wing commander, equivalent to an army major
A person entrusted with the custody or care of something or someone; a caretaker or keeper.
definitions.example: After their parents' death, their aunt became the children's custodian.

definitions.definition: A janitor; a cleaner
definitions.example: The custodian does such admirable work, deftly wielding a mop to keep our hallways and sidewalks free of buai pekpek left by people who chew betelnuts to be "cool" but don't even bother finding a rubbish bin or spit cup to dispose of the pekpek with.

definitions.definition: A wedding feast or festival; a wedding.
Of or pertaining to a bride, or to wedding; nuptial.
definitions.example: bridal ornaments; a bridal outfit; a bridal chamber

definitions.definition: In qualitative metre, a metrical foot consisting of three syllables, two unstressed and one stressed (e.g., the word "interrupt").
In quantitative metre, a metrical foot consisting of three syllables, two short and one long (e.g., the word "velveteen").
A fragment, phrase or line of poetry or verse using this meter, e.g.
To cheer, to cheer up, to gladden, to make happy.
definitions.example: Good news exhilarates the mind; wine exhilarates the drinker.

definitions.definition: To excite, to thrill.
An Italian grape-based spirit of between 80 and 100 proof, made from the distillation of pomace.
A variety or serving of grappa.
Characterized by brawn; muscular, thewy; strong.
definitions.example: Rattler was a big, brawny fellow, and he stepped up in front of me, rolling up his sleeves.

definitions.definition: Calloused; hardened.
(chiefly in the plural) One of the short straps tied between the legs of unfenced horses, allowing them to wander short distances but preventing them from running off.
An unsteady, off-balance step.
A difficult situation; a scrape.
An odd job; a piece of casual work.
To fetter by tying the legs; to restrict (a horse) with hobbles.
To walk lame, or unevenly.
To move roughly or irregularly.
To perplex; to embarrass.

The branch of engineering that deals with the design, construction and operation of industrial process plants, and the physical, chemical and biological processes to create substances or energy in a useful and economic form.
A form of the game of rugby, historically amateur, having 15 players per side; points are scored for a try, penalty, drop kick or conversion.
(of an idea or plan etc) Absurd, foolish or stupid.
(of a person) Frivolous and silly; featherbrained or scatterbrained.
A game played between two teams, each consisting of a female and a male.
Composition that has several short movements, a style that composers started to use in the 18th century.
A cucumber preserved in a solution, usually a brine or a vinegar syrup.
definitions.example: A pickle goes well with a hamburger.

definitions.definition: (often in the plural) Any vegetable preserved in vinegar and consumed as relish.
The brine used for preserving food.
definitions.example: This tub is filled with the pickle that we will put the small cucumbers into.

definitions.definition: A difficult situation; peril.
definitions.example: The climber found himself in a pickle when one of the rocks broke off.

definitions.definition: A mildly mischievous loved one.
A rundown.
definitions.example: Jones was caught in a pickle between second and third.

definitions.definition: A children’s game with three participants that emulates a baseball rundown
definitions.example: The boys played pickle in the front yard for an hour.

definitions.definition: A penis.
A pipe for smoking methamphetamine.
definitions.example: Load some shards in that pickle.

definitions.definition: A bath of dilute sulphuric or nitric acid, etc., to remove burnt sand, scale, rust, etc., from the surface of castings, or other articles of metal, or to brighten them or improve their colour.
In an optical landing system, the hand-held controller connected to the lens, or apparatus on which the lights are mounted.
To preserve food (or sometimes other things) in a salt, sugar or vinegar solution.
definitions.example: These cucumbers pickle very well.

definitions.definition: To remove high-temperature scale and oxidation from metal with heated (often sulphuric) industrial acid.
definitions.example: The crew will pickle the fittings in the morning.

definitions.definition: (in the Python programming language) To serialize.
To pour brine over a person after flogging them, as a method of punishment.
A kernel; a grain (of salt, sugar, etc.)

A small or indefinite quantity or amount (of something); a little, a bit, a few. Usually in partitive construction, frequently without "of"; a single grain or kernel of wheat, barley, oats, sand or dust.
To eat sparingly.
To pilfer.
In art, the use of small areas of color to construct an image.
A place where pedestrians are permitted to or advised to cross a street.
An outlet from a liquid/fluid main often consisting of an upright pipe with a valve attached from which fluid (e.g. water or fuel) can be tapped.
One who disobeys.
Not obedient.
An innocent, unsophisticated, naïve, wholesome girl or young woman.
A dramatic role of such a woman; an actress playing such a role.
A bookmaker, being a person who, or business which, takes bets from the general public on sporting events and similar.
Someone who writes the biography of a saint.
Someone who writes praising and flattering things about a person (as if that person were a saint).
A person who dies without making a valid will.
Without a valid will indicating whom to leave one's estate to after death.
Not devised or bequeathed; not disposed of by will.
A sequence of images depicting people or objects in motion, preserved on a recording medium and capable of being projected for viewing.
definitions.example: Some technical knowledge of cameras and lighting is needed to create a motion picture.

definitions.definition: A movie.
definitions.example: “Gone with the Wind” is my favorite motion picture.

definitions.definition: Specter, ghost, haunting spirit
To make grim; to give a stern or forbidding aspect to.
Dismal and gloomy, cold and forbidding
definitions.example: Life was grim in many northern industrial towns.

definitions.definition: Rigid and unrelenting
definitions.example: His grim determination enabled him to win.

definitions.definition: Ghastly or sinister
definitions.example: A grim castle overshadowed the village.

definitions.definition: Disgusting; gross
Anger, wrath.

A flavoured alcoholic beverage that is usually very sweet and contains a high percentage of alcohol. Cordials are a type of liqueur manufactured using the infusion process as opposed to the essence and distillation processes.
To flavor or treat (wine) with a liqueur
To top up bottles of sparkling wine with a sugar solution
definitions.example: Every champagne has to be liqueured after its disgorgement, to replace the inevitable loss.

definitions.definition: The study of the physical sounds of human speech, concerned with the physical properties of speech sounds (phones), and the processes of their physiological production, auditory reception, and neurophysiological perception, and their representation by written symbols.
A chemist whose speciality is biochemistry
A man of business.
A busybody.
A public decree.
The study of the use of language in a social context.
Any bird of the genus Falco, all of which are birds of prey.
A female such bird, a male being a tiercel.
A light cannon used from the 15th to the 17th century; a falconet.
To hunt with a falcon or falcons.
A novel or drama concerning a crime (usually a murder) in which a detective follows clues to determine the perpetrator.
A leaf of a book or manuscript
A page of a book, that is, one side of a leaf of a book.
A page number. The even folios are on the left-hand pages and the odd folios on the right-hand pages.
A sheet of paper folded in half.
(books) A book made of sheets of paper each folded in half (two leaves or four pages to the sheet); hence, a book of the largest kind, exceeding 30 cm in height.
definitions.example: A rare copy of Shakespeare’s First Folio.

definitions.definition: A page in an account book; sometimes, two opposite pages bearing the same serial number.

(19th to early 20th century) A leaf containing a certain number of words; hence, a certain number of words in a writing, as in England, in law proceedings 72, and in chancery, 90; in New York, 100 words.
A wrapper for loose papers.
To put a serial number on each folio or page of (a book); to page
An omnivorous mammal, Ailurus fulgens, native to the Himalayas and eastern Asia, which has dark red fur and a ringed tail.
A coin-operated machine that plays recorded music; it has push-buttons to make selections.
An automated carousel for the storage and retrieval of tapes, CD-ROMs, etc.
(by extension) A software application capable of replaying tracks from a digital music collection.
To play and listen to music from a jukebox.
To play (music or digital content) on a jukebox
(by extension) To play or repeat as if on a jukebox.
To format or set up for playing by a jukebox.
Any of several subdued tints of colors, usually associated with pink, peach, yellow, green, blue and lavender
A drawing made with any of those colors.
A type of dried paste used to make crayons.
A crayon made from such a paste.
Woad.
definitions.example: Wool was dyed in the pastel vat.

definitions.definition: A traditional dish in various Latin American countries, resembling a tamale, pasty, or calzone.
A soft flavoured sweet/candy.

A medicinal pill, originally compressed herbs. A throat pastille is a large candy-like lozenge, which, when sucked, releases oils to soothe a sore throat and sometimes vapors to help unblock the nose or sinuses.
A small granular half-spheroid piece of material.
A small cone of charcoal and aromatic substances, burned either as incense, or as a means of diffusing an agreeable odour.
A paper tube containing a firework that causes a small wheel to rotate in burning.
From side to side; across.
definitions.example: Above, the stars appeared to move slowly athwart.

definitions.definition: Across the path (of something).
definitions.example: a fleet standing athwart our course

definitions.definition: Wrongly; perplexingly.
From one side to the other side of.
definitions.example: The stars moved slowly athwart the sky.

definitions.definition: Across the line of a ship's course or across its deck.
definitions.example: The damaged mainmast fell athwart the deck, destroying the ship's boat.

definitions.definition: Across the path or course of; opposing.
Benevolent altruism with the intention of increasing the well-being of humankind.
Charitable giving, charity.
definitions.example: As public funding is reduced, we depend increasingly on private philanthropy.

definitions.definition: A philanthropic act.
definitions.example: His tombstone lists his various philanthropies.

definitions.definition: A charitable foundation.
definitions.example: the Rockefeller philanthropies

definitions.definition: A natural attraction or feeling of kinship to a person or thing.
A family relationship through marriage of a relative (e.g. sister-in-law), as opposed to consanguinity (e.g. sister).
A kinsman or kinswoman of a such relationship; one who is affinal.
The fact of and manner in which something is related to another.
Any romantic relationship.
Any passionate love for something.
Resemblances between biological populations; resemblances that suggest that they are of a common origin, type or stock.
Structural resemblances between minerals; resemblances that suggest that they are of a common origin or type.
An attractive force between atoms, or groups of atoms, that contributes towards their forming bonds
The attraction between an antibody and an antigen
Tendency to keep a task running on the same processor in a symmetric multiprocessing operating system to reduce the frequency of cache misses
An automorphism of affine space.
An excessive estimate or rate.
To esteem too highly; to give greater praise than due.
Illegally produced Irish whiskey; moonshine.
(by extension) An unlicensed drinking establishment selling illegally produced Irish whiskey.
A team sport played with bat and ball with one fielding side and one batting side. It is similar to softball and baseball.
A Methodist preacher traveling a circuit, also referred to as a circuit rider.
A railroad man who worked at a roundhouse, operating the turntable.
A person who earns a living by playing cards
A person who makes the rounds of bars, saloons, and similar establishments; figuratively, a debaucher or roué
One who rounds; one who comes about frequently or regularly.
A tool for making an edge or surface round.
A roll of banknotes or other paper currency, carried in lieu of a wallet.
definitions.example: Phil kept his bankroll in his front pocket, as it made too much of a lump to sit on.

definitions.definition: The monetary assets of a person or organization.
definitions.example: Microsoft is a corporation with an extremely large bankroll.

definitions.definition: To fund a project; to underwrite something.
definitions.example: Professor Stebbins didn't need to apply for government grants because his lab was bankrolled by a large pharmaceutical corporation.

definitions.definition: The state of being receptive
The extent to which something is receptive
One who bets (punts) against the bank.
One who oars or poles a punt (pontoon).
One who punts a football.
One who gambles. See speculator.
A customer of a commercial establishment, frequently of a pub or (alternatively) of a prostitute.
A beginner or unskilled climber.
The person who keeps score in basset or ombre.
A program used to forcibly disconnect another user from a network.
A dish (usually meat) prepared by braising.
definitions.example: Pot roast is typically a braise, as is osso buco.

definitions.definition: A sauce used for braising.
definitions.example: Braised cabbage is cooked in a braise of sliced bacon, one or two thickly sliced onions, one or two sliced carrots, parsley, thyme, a bay leaf, and stock to nearly cover.

definitions.definition: To cook in a small amount of liquid, in a covered pan, somewhere between steaming and boiling.
A kind of small charcoal used for roasting ore.
To join two metal pieces, without melting them, using heat and diffusion of a jointing alloy of capillary thickness.
To burn or temper in fire.
Pagellus bogaraveo, syn. Pagellus centrodontus (sea bream)
Pertaining to marriage.
Pertaining to a husband.
(of a person) Angry, agitated.
A small fruit, usually red, black or yellow, with a smooth hard seed and a short hard stem.
Prunus subg. Cerasus, trees or shrubs that bear cherries.
The wood of a cherry tree.
(color) Cherry red.
Virginity, especially female virginity as embodied by a hymen.
A subtree consisting of a node with exactly two leaves.
A cricket ball.
Cherrytop.
Burning tip of a cigarette.
Containing or having the taste of cherries.
Of a bright red colour; cherry red.
(often of cars) In excellent condition; mint condition.
A small, open-wheeled vehicle for racing.
A framework moving on casters, designed to support children as they learn to walk.
A Japanese breed of fighting dog
Totally reprehensible.
definitions.example: I hope they catch the person responsible for that heinous crime.

definitions.definition: A child's nurse.
A grandmother.
A godmother.
A female goat.
To serve as a nanny.
To treat like a nanny's charges; to coddle.
A minor traffic accident where one vehicle runs in to the back of another.
(of traffic) Arranged in close formation, one behind the other.
(of traffic) Moving slowly in this manner.
Entirely, from head to toe.
A type of malignancy affecting the blood cells or blood-forming tissues.
Any specific form or type of cancer of the blood-forming tissues.
definitions.example: The subjects suffered from lymphoblastic and myeloid leukemias.

definitions.definition: A small backpack, suitable for a one-day hike or for carrying books around campus.
Acronym of window, icon, menu, pointer. (a graphical interface paradigm)
Acronym of window-icon-mouse program.
A hypothetical class of particle, proposed to explain the dark matter problem.
Someone who lacks confidence or courage, is weak, ineffectual, irresolute and wishy-washy
To behave submissively.
To render wimpy.
To replace stale or noxious air with fresh.
To circulate air through a building, etc.
To provide with a vent.
To expose something to the circulation of fresh air.
To expose something to public examination or discussion.
To provide manual or mechanical breathing to a patient.
To shoot with a firearm; to pierce with bullets.
Anything that is seasonal, such as a financial trend, a product for sale, or an employee.
Of, related to or reliant on a season or period of the year, especially with regard to weather characteristics.
A medicine or other agent to assist hearing.
Pertaining to the sense of hearing, the organs of hearing, or the science of sounds; auditory.
Naturally producing or produced by an instrument without electrical amplification, as an acoustic guitar or acoustic piano.
(retronym) A hollow-body guitar of the older variety, in contradistinction to an electric guitar.
Suffering from sickness, nausea or dizziness due to the motion of a ship at sea.
An entertainer who performs in a humorous manner, especially by telling jokes.
(by extension) Any person who is humorous or amusing, either characteristically or on a particular occasion.
A person who performs in theatrical plays.
A writer of comedies.
A subgenre of reggae that incorporates hip hop, rhythm and blues and sampling; dancehall
(often capitalized) A form of Japanese theatre in which elaborately costumed male performers use stylized movements, dances, and songs in order to enact tragedies and comedies.
A concentrated noncarbonated soft drink which is diluted with water before drinking.
An individual serving of such a diluted drink.
A pleasant-tasting medicine.
A liqueur prepared using the infusion process.
A candy (or bonbon) usually made of milk chocolate, filled with small fruits (often maraschino cherries) and syrup or fondant.
Anything that revives or comforts.
Hearty; sincere; warm; affectionate.
Radiating warmth and friendliness; genial.
Tending to revive, cheer, or invigorate; giving strength or spirits.
Proceeding from the heart.
A person or group that acts in an auxiliary manner.
A sailing vessel equipped with an engine.
(grammar) An auxiliary verb.
A marching band colorguard.
Helping; giving assistance or support.
definitions.example: auxiliary troops

definitions.definition: Supplementary or subsidiary.
Held in reserve for exceptional circumstances.
Of a ship, having both sails and an engine.
(grammar) Relating to an auxiliary verb.
A machine which translates linear motion of wind to rotational motion by means of adjustable vanes called sails.
The structure containing such machinery.
A child's toy consisting of vanes mounted on a stick that rotate when blown by a person or by the wind.
A dunk where the dunker swings his arm in a circular motion before throwing the ball through the hoop.
A guitar move where the strumming hand mimics a turning windmill.
A breakdancing move in which the dancer rolls his/her torso continuously in a circular path on the floor, across the upper chest, shoulders and back, while twirling the legs in a V shape in the air.
Any of various large papilionid butterflies of the genus Byasa, the wings of which resemble the vanes of a windmill.
The false shower.
An imaginary enemy, but presented as real.
To rotate with a sweeping motion.
definitions.example: She ran down the hill, windmilling her arms with glee.

definitions.definition: Of a rotating part of a machine, to (become disengaged and) rotate freely.
definitions.example: The axle broke and the wheel windmilled in place briefly before careening through the wall.

definitions.definition: One of the component parts of the calyx, particularly when the sepals in a plant's calyx are not fused into a single structure.
A shrill noise, especially made by a voice or bird; a yell, scream, or call.
A four-digit transponder code used by aircraft for identification or transmission of emergency signals.
An issue or complaint related to aircraft maintenance.
The American night heron.
A warning message indicating a possible error.
To make a squawking noise; to yell, scream, or call out shrilly.
To speak out; to protest.
To report an infraction; to rat on or tattle; to disclose a secret.
To produce a warning message, indicating a possible error.
To set or transmit a four-digit transponder code. (Normally followed by the specific code in question.)
To back out in a mean way.
(radio communications) Used to indicate agreement and compliance.
definitions.example: Wilco, Bravo Six Three will take the north road. Bravo Six Four will take the south road, out.

definitions.definition: A species of South American tree, Anadenanthera colubrina.
To assign a duty or responsibility to
To assign (a debit) to an account
definitions.example: Let's charge this to marketing.

definitions.definition: To pay on account, as by using a credit card
definitions.example: Can I charge my purchase to my credit card?

definitions.definition: To require payment (of) (a price or fee, for goods, services, etc.)
definitions.example: I won't charge you for the wheat

definitions.definition: (possibly archaic) to sell at a given price.
definitions.example: to charge coal at $5 per unit

definitions.definition: To formally accuse (a person) of a crime.
definitions.example: I'm charging you with assault and battery.

definitions.definition: To impute or ascribe
To call to account; to challenge
To place a burden or load on or in
To load equipment with material required for its use, as a firearm with powder, a fire hose with water, a chemical reactor with raw materials
definitions.example: Charge your weapons; we're moving up.

definitions.definition: To move forward quickly and forcefully, particularly in combat and/or on horseback
(of a hunting dog) to lie on the belly and be still (A command given by a hunter to a dog)
The tenderest part of a loin of meat, especially of pork or beef.
A district of a city where corruption is common, often because the district is devoted to questionable businesses (peep shows, etc) which are easy for police to blackmail and extort.
To use a needle to pass thread repeatedly through (pieces of fabric) in order to join them together.
definitions.example: Balls were first made of grass or leaves held together by strings, and later of pieces of animal skin sewn together and stuffed with feathers or hay.

definitions.definition: To use a needle to pass thread repeatedly through pieces of fabric in order to join them together.
Followed by into: to enclose by sewing.
definitions.example: to sew money into a bag

definitions.definition: To drain the water from.
Of a ship, to be grounded.
The action of the verb to sew.
Something that is being or has been sewn.
definitions.example: She put down her sewing and went to answer the door.

definitions.definition: The stage area between the curtain and the orchestra.
The stage area immediately in front of the scene building.
The row of columns at the front the scene building, at first directly behind the circular orchestra but later upon a stage.
A proscenium arch.
Any type of lamellophone having a small sound box fitted with a row of tuned tabs that are plucked with the thumbs; a mbira.
The act of forging metal into shape.
definitions.example: the forgery of horseshoes

definitions.definition: The act of forging, fabricating, or producing falsely; especially the crime of fraudulently making or altering a writing or signature purporting to be made by another, the false making or material alteration of or addition to a written instrument for the purpose of deceit and fraud.
definitions.example: the forgery of a bond

definitions.definition: That which is forged, fabricated, falsely devised or counterfeited.
An invention, creation.
The chemistry of those compounds that occur in living organisms, and the processes that occur in their metabolism and catabolism
The chemical characteristics of a particular living organism
definitions.example: The biochemistries of fungal and bacterial cells are quite distinct.

definitions.definition: The biochemical activity associated with a particular chemical or condition
definitions.example: Our study compared the biochemistries of epilepsy and Parkinson's.

definitions.definition: The process of getting something to float again.
definitions.example: A small crowd on the docks watched the attempted refloat of the ship.

definitions.definition: To cause to float again.
definitions.example: Removing fuel from the sunken ship will make it easier to refloat it.

definitions.definition: A stone that can be stepped on in crossing something, especially a marsh or creek.
Something used as a way to progress to something or somewhere else.
A Chinese martial art.
The aurora of the southern hemisphere
